results.abstract: Sen John Kerry shows his looser, more jovial side in final days of presidential race, replacing brooding, super-serious persona he has displayed on campaign trail for much of year; he is delivering new lines in his stripped-down stump speech with determination; those closest to him say he is genuinely moved by huge crowds at his campaign stops, voters he meets, and political and cultural heroes who introduce him at campaign rallies, including former Pres Clinton, Bruce Springsteen and former astronaut and Ohio senator John Glenn; photos (M)

headline.main: A Looser, More Jovial Kerry Prepares for Voters' Choice

results.snippet: Stuffed into a hotel elevator in the first hours of Saturday morning, Senator John Kerry put his loyal and long-suffering press secretary, David Wade, in a mock headlock, then swatted him in the back of the head. ''Not bad for 30 points down in New...
results.lead_paragraph: Stuffed into a hotel elevator in the first hours of Saturday morning, Senator John Kerry put his loyal and long-suffering press secretary, David Wade, in a mock headlock, then swatted him in the back of the head. ''Not bad for 30 points down in New Hampshire, eh?'' Mr. Wade recalled Mr. Kerry saying. A year ago, as former President Bill Clinton said as he stood by his side last week before some 100,000 fans in Philadelphia, Mr. Kerry's quest for even the Democratic nomination seemed ''dead as a doornail.'' Now he is in a dead heat for the big prize. His desperate ditching of his campaign manager and mortgaging his house to reverse seemingly impossible odds in this state's early primary are but a bad dream.

headline.kicker: THE WAY WE LIVE NOW: 11-7-04: QUESTIONS FOR RICHARD BRANSON

results.snippet: The British mogul  whose empire extends to airplanes, music and soon Mars  launches ... what else? A reality show.
results.lead_paragraph: Q:You're a knight of the British realm and one of Britain's wealthiest entrepreneurs. Why would you want to be the host of the reality show ''The Rebel Billionaire,'' which makes its debut on Fox on Tuesday? If ''Rebel Billionaire'' is a success, Virgin will be almost as well known in America as it is in England.

results.abstract: John W Seljan, 86, is found guilty in first trial under federal law passed in 2003 that strengthened ability to crack down on sexual predators who travel overseas to molest children; Judge Alicemarie H Stotler oversees nonjury trial in Federal District Court, Santa Ana, Calif (M)

headline.main: Man, 86, Convicted Under New Law Against Americans Who Go Abroad to Molest Minors

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: FAR EAST, SOUTH AND SOUTHEAST ASIA AND PACIFIC AREAS

results.snippet: John W. Seljan was found guilty of six counts related to molesting children, including the rapes of two girls younger than 12.
results.lead_paragraph: An 86-year-old man was found guilty of six felonies on Friday in the first trial under a federal law passed last year that strengthened the ability to crack down on sexual predators who travel overseas to molest children. When federal investigators arrested the man, John W. Seljan, in October 2003, he admitted that he had been taking at least three trips a year to Southeast Asia for 20 years. His main aim, he said, was to ''educate'' small children, some not yet 10 years old, sexually.

results.abstract: Article on success of high school football teams from New Rochelle, NY, which are in contention in four of five classes; New Rochelle, Rye, Dobbs Ferry and Tuckahoe High Schools are competing in Class AA, B, C and D semifinals, respectively, and over past two years, Westchester teams have played in five of 10 state championships and won three; photos (L)

headline.main: 2-4-6-8, Best Football in the State! (Who Knew?)

results.snippet: Not quite Odessa, Tex., but as standard bearer for a strong county, New Rochelle knows how to stay out front.
results.lead_paragraph: FRED CAMPBELL avoided the sports pages and ignored the polls. He didn't need anyone to tell him what he had to do or whom he had to beat. He didn't want to talk about predictions or rankings or what would happen if he won and how he would feel if he lost. Football had eclipsed everything else in his life, and by last week his mind had attained a near-perfect focus.

results.abstract: Profile of and interview with Nile Rodgers of Westport, Conn, who recruited rock artists to create soundtrack for recently released sci-fi video game, Halo 2; photos (M)

headline.main: Combat Rock By Way Of R&B

results.snippet: HIS signature rhythm guitar licks launched a series of hits heard by tens of millions. He has produced David Bowie, Madonna, Bob Dylan, Diana Ross and Eric Clapton. His group, Chic, redefined R&B, and helped invent hip-hop.    But if you really want...
results.lead_paragraph: HIS signature rhythm guitar licks launched a series of hits heard by tens of millions. He has produced David Bowie, Madonna, Bob Dylan, Diana Ross and Eric Clapton. His group, Chic, redefined R&B, and helped invent hip-hop. But if you really want to get Nile Rodgers excited these days, bypass the history and talk about video games instead. Specifically, the sci-fi extravaganza Halo 2, which he calls ''the most important thing in my life right now.''

results.snippet: WEIGHING ANCHORS Viewed from a certain angle, ex-anchors are like ex-presidents - very important men who suddenly have a lot of time on their hands. More than a few have had trouble leaving behind the days millions hung on their every word.
results.lead_paragraph: WEIGHING ANCHORS -- Viewed from a certain angle, ex-anchors are like ex-presidents -- very important men who suddenly have a lot of time on their hands. More than a few have had trouble leaving behind the days millions hung on their every word. Walter Cronkite quit in 1981 at 65, expecting that his career would continue, but in a less hectic way. But Mr. Cronkite recently told The Associated Press that CBS never seemed interested in using him much and added: ''If I'd known that my health would be so good for so long, I wouldn't have quit anchoring that early.''
